page.title: 16THE ELECTRONIC AGE?
page.content: We gathered our information from {local shopkeepers}and{workers in {larger companies.}It seems as time goes by that more{electronic devices} are being used in everyday life. {Electronic cash registers}were introduced circa{1975}and are used in{ {14}out of{23 shops}questioned. Other devices such as{electronic scales, {burglar alarms and security monitors} are not as common. Only{5}out of{27}businesses use{ {computers}at present. They are used mainly in{accounting and stock control but also for{controlling machinery, {storing information and invoicing.}The result is{cheaper and accurate}work at the expense of{jobs.}Some manual jobs like{book-keeping}cannot be replaced. Most{new technology}has been introduced in larger businesses where they can afford to expand.
